urls.title: Episode Two: Thank you Croatia
urls.description: Listen to this episode from Away From Home on Spotify. We take you inside the dressing room with Shakhtar Donetsk as they prepare for their next Champions League match against Celtic. Whilst The Athletic’s Adam Crafton follows the team in Warsaw, his colleague Joey D'Urso is in Croatia. He meets with the children from the club’s academy who are kept safe and out of harm’s way, but pine for their friends and family back home in Ukraine. We then return to Warsaw for match day - can the underdogs get another result? We start with an emotional team-talk from the club’s captain Taras Stepanenko… Credits: Presenters: Adam Crafton and Joey D'Urso Producers: Adam Crafton, Joey D'Urso, Abi Paterson, and Mike Stavrou Sound Mixing: Ollie Bellwood Featuring footage from: CBS with dressing room footage & audio kindly supplied by Shakhtar Donetsk.

This guy is constantly quoted in the press (or at least was until the bubble burst) thanks to his relentless self-promotion, and journalists understandably wanting to hear a "positive case" for crypto. He's a compete charlatan who shouldn't be taken seriously.

Grifters like Tim - who bizarrely once accused me of being paid by crypto companies and failed to retract - are desperate to make out this stuff is very complicated. Actually the con is pretty simple and the emperor has no clothes. https://t.co/EjzLcYXEPI

urls.title: Why are there still empty seats at 'sold out' World Cup matches?
urls.description: The way the ticket situation has panned out raises real concerns there will be empty seats in the World Cup's final stages

data.text: https://t.co/1wxAoWAEZc
https://t.co/tKZaCqpbYs

This sort of stuff does exist, and is cool, I guess. But it costs hundreds of dollars to even enter. And clearly loads of token holders have no interest in this, they just view it as an investment. https://t.co/nXc58rRgQ3

This is a vast wealth transfer from the global poor to the global super-rich facilitated by elite football. Financially insecure Turkish people would probably  be wary of some random crypto token. One endorsed by Messi, Arsenal, Barcelona etc? That's different.

These might just look like random squiggles on graphs. But it seems clear from social media that the biggest market for this is Turkey, where the domestic currency has collapsed... so people buy crypto to try to hedge against inflation. 

Then they lose even more money. https://t.co/pw8m4CqIoy

Both countries have of course done well at the World Cup so far, so you might expect the tokens to go up... but no, traders "buy the rumour, sell the news" and they keep tanking.

The house always wins, of course. $ARG $POR https://t.co/2HZdEbFlqT

“Fan tokens are not about financial investment," said a Socios spokesperson.

I'm sick of this shit — it's obviously not true. Just search $ARG and $POR on Twitter. Obvious nonsense.

New: Portugal and Argentina "fan tokens," issued by Socios and promoted by  Messi, surged in value just before the tournament. Investors piled in, hoping the World Cup would cause the tokens to increase in value.

You'll never guess what happened next! https://t.co/wmHzBNebyW

urls.title: The Messi-backed World Cup crypto crash that is harming Turkish investors
urls.description: There was a surge in sales of 'fan tokens' ahead of the World Cup, but their value has tanked and some investors have lost everything

data.text: "Dafanews" advertised all over the Pakistan v England test match. Dafanews is a sham, it's a faux-news website which is a front for betting company Dafabet. But betting is tightly restricted in India/Pakistan. Weird!

urls.title: What does the World Cup mean to the Middle East and Arab world?
urls.description: 'An Arabic country, a Muslim country, it represents us,' said Tunisia fan Ghaze. Abdul, a Moroccan, said: 'All the people here are brothers'

tweets.text:
The Arab world is massive & disparate, but the first majority Muslim country to reach the semi-finals is colossal.

I’m grateful to Grant Wahl for helping me make it as a soccer writer, but I’m more grateful that his urge to help people who could use his help extended all throughout soccer and way beyond it. I hope we live up to that.

Waking up to shocking news that @GrantWahl died in Qatar, apparently from a heart attack. Football had no greater advocate in N America than Grant, who also once stood for the Fifa presidency, to highlight Fifa corruption. Thoughts with his family. RIP

tweets.text:
New: fresh evidence on Socios fan tokens reveals holders spend an average of £150 (€181), suggesting this "fan engagement" is in fact a wildly lucrative crypto trading scheme.

Tokens are now tanking, with fans/investors - many in Turkey - are losing out.
https://t.co/seeXyDlksi
https://t.co/tKZaCqpbYs

New: I've spent months looking at Socios, "fan engagement tokens" promoted by lots of Europe's biggest clubs.

It reveals a world of frantic cryptocurrency "pumping and dumping" where smart traders can make money from less "financially sophisticated" fans.
https://t.co/uGffB94GKk

urls.title: Special investigation: Socios 'fan tokens' - what they really are and how they work
urls.description: Socios have teamed up with clubs including PSG, Inter Milan and Leeds but little was known about the 'fan engagement tokens' - until now

tweets.text: This sort of stuff does exist, and is cool, I guess. But it costs hundreds of dollars to even enter. And clearly loads of token holders have no interest in this, they just view it as an investment. https://t.co/nXc58rRgQ3

This is a vast wealth transfer from the global poor to the global super-rich facilitated by elite football. Financially insecure Turkish people would probably  be wary of some random crypto token. One endorsed by Messi, Arsenal, Barcelona etc? That's different.

These might just look like random squiggles on graphs. But it seems clear from social media that the biggest market for this is Turkey, where the domestic currency has collapsed... so people buy crypto to try to hedge against inflation. 

Then they lose even more money. https://t.co/pw8m4CqIoy

Both countries have of course done well at the World Cup so far, so you might expect the tokens to go up... but no, traders "buy the rumour, sell the news" and they keep tanking.

The house always wins, of course. $ARG $POR https://t.co/2HZdEbFlqT

“Fan tokens are not about financial investment," said a Socios spokesperson.

I'm sick of this shit — it's obviously not true. Just search $ARG and $POR on Twitter. Obvious nonsense.

New: Portugal and Argentina "fan tokens," issued by Socios and promoted by  Messi, surged in value just before the tournament. Investors piled in, hoping the World Cup would cause the tokens to increase in value.

You'll never guess what happened next! https://t.co/wmHzBNebyW

urls.title: The Messi-backed World Cup crypto crash that is harming Turkish investors
urls.description: There was a surge in sales of 'fan tokens' ahead of the World Cup, but their value has tanked and some investors have lost everything

tweets.text:
Trawl the internet & Yann Gueho almost ceases to exist.

He was in Chelsea's academy, Clairefontaine & rated more highly than Mbappe. But he's never played a professional game.

This is the story of his talent, prison spells & a belated diagnosis of bipolar disorder.

@stujames75

@josephmdurso I'd say this is because of Saka's evangelical faith, in which sharing the message of God is essential, in contrast to how more traditional Catholic and Protestant  Christians would refrain from expressing their beliefs publicly. It is in any case a fascinating subject.

@josephmdurso Forgive me if you were aware but a deep dive into census shows immigration and Ethnic Minorities actually prevented a steeper decline in Christianity. Black census respondents were more likely to select Christian as a faith than White respondents.
@josephmdurso Incredible Gavin Peacock erasure 😉
Saka. Inspirational young player, inspirational young man. https://t.co/E08TOWc311

"Kane needs to be connected with the game. Kylian is the opposite. If he doesn't touch the ball, he’s relaxed."

The ChatGPT excitement is a valuable counterexample to the claims of blockchain and crypto hypemen. If a technology is revolutionary, it is very often immediately apparent to non-technical people. Even they don't know how it will develop, they can tell it's full of potential.

The worker fell when asked to fix the lights in a car park. The government is investigating.

@FIFAWorldCup make the tickets none refundable, and none transferable when purchased now!! End this madness.

@josephmdurso Is it not Ole Nippon?!

"Dafanews" advertised all over the Pakistan v England test match. Dafanews is a sham, it's a faux-news website which is a front for betting company Dafabet. But betting is tightly restricted in India/Pakistan. Weird!

tweets.text:
The Mexico-Saudi-Poland-Argentina drama last night was exhilarating.

It also could be the last of its kind — unless FIFA reconsiders its plan for three-team groups.

On that, + a humble proposal for four groups of 12 and a "wild-card round" in 2026:

urls.title: FIFA plans to kill the drama of the World Cup group stage. Here’s how to save it
urls.description: FIFA's current plan to move from eight groups of four to 16 groups of three would be a needless detonation of two of the most thrilling weeks in all of sport.

urls.title: Suriname, the tiny nation responsible for some of the greatest footballers of all time

Ghana making time-wasting substitutions when they need two goals, just to ensure Suarez is eliminated. This is generational hating.

@josephmdurso I think this is true of most commentary in most fields. With politics you get a lot of Westminster gossip and beef because it’s easy to do and superficially gripping. Pop interviews rarely even touch on how music is made.
A St Johnstone player has just sent a PSG player for a hot dog, what a sport 🤣 https://t.co/24DoLVSfH4

@josephmdurso It's also notable how VAR was supposedly brought in to avoid having endless conversations about refereeing decisions, only to instead lead to endless conversations about VAR decisions instead.
Keep the Group Standings in the corner of the screen at all times during the Final Group games imo.
Joe Root the only batter not to score a ton today. His job is to score runs. What’s he bringing to this team exactly? Drop him for Callum Wilson.

urls.title: Introducing our World Cup migrant worker diaries: Meet Karun, Jagat, Joseph and Victor
urls.description: Four migrant workers are keeping a diary for The Athletic throughout the tournament, documenting their time in Qatar as the football unfolds

tweets.text:
We cannot forget the Qatar World Cup is built on migrant labour.

With the help of @EquidemOrg, we wanted to let workers write their story, directly.

This is the first edition of our Alternative World Cup Diary - so meet Karun, Jagat, Joseph and Victor.

https://t.co/OsbBEQCyAL
The Vietnam national team clinch a late win ⏹ https://t.co/w6hvgHPzyh

urls.title: FIFA consider introducing group-stage penalty shootouts
